intro: Xanthophyllum rectum, commonly known as the straight yellowleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically yellow-green in color. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Xanthophyllum rectum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
